ovdesc.p: The EB.FREE.MESSAGE Application is used to store both outward and inward messages. Messages can be sent to either Customers or SWIFT addresses. Consult the Delivery User Guide on the use of EB.ACTIVITY and EB.ADVICES.

desc.p: The ID of the free-form message request/receipt
The format is FMyydddnnnn.
Accepts Standard date format . This field is defaulted from LETTER.OF.CREDIT or DRAWINGS which have TRACER.DATE field set.
This can also be manually changed which will in turn update the file ‘EB.SCHEDULE.TRACER’ which keeps track of the tracers and when they are scheduled to be sent.
Validation Rules: :
Mandatory if TRACER.STAT is ‘SCHED’.
Set this field to "Y" to preview the message.
Holds the current Status of the Tracer and accepts the following values :
‘ ‘ – If the field is left blank it indicates the non-tracer type.
SCHED – Indicates that the Tracer is Scheduled to be sent on a future date. If it is set as ‘SCHED’ then the TRACER.DATE becomes mandatory.

STOP - Indicates that the tracer which was Scheduled is Stopped for some reason. Once the Status is set as STOP, this message record is removed and written to the History file during the End of Day process.
Validation Rules: :
Mandatory Input for tracer
Allowed values – SCHED , STOP.
The T24 ID of the customer who sent/receives the message.

Free format multivalue field to be mapped directly to tag 79 of the message types MT499, MT799.
Accepts Swift characters.
A multivalue set can hold 35 lines with 50 characters each.

Accepts valid number of days. This gets defaulted from LETTER.OF.CREDIT which has TRACER.DAYS set. If left blank, it gets thedefault value from COUNTRY file or from the EB.FREE.PARAMETERS file. This indicates the period after which the tracer message should be recycled and sent again. Tracer messages are generated during the End of Day process.
Validation Rules: :
Tracer days should be like ‘+nW’ or ‘ nW’ where ‘n’ stands for the number of days and ‘W’ stands for Working days.
The text version of the customer address or the S.W.I.F.T BIC Code prefixed with SW-.
The customer address will be automatically completed when the customer ID is entered.
In the absence of the customer number this field should be completed only by the valid swift address prefixed with SW-
The S.W.I.F.T address should exist in DE.SWIFT.BOOK and the validations are done only when the customer number field is null.
